body:
Yep, I'd be for adding such a constructor. Just to check, do you need to set the header for a specific part in the body, or the top level request header?

```
POST /blah HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 300 (this one?)
Content-Type: multipart/form

--boundary
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="foo"
Content-Length: 200 (or this one?)

some 200 bytes
--boundary--
```
It would be for each part so the multipart logic can correctly calculate the top level content length

issue.title: Adds client library
issue.body: This adds a fully functional Rust client SDK. As part of this I moved around a few structs and what not and broke the server and client into separate features so people can import only what they need. Please note that the `get_parcel_stream` does not currently work because it doesn't allow for setting of the `Content-Length` header. This is being tracked in https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/1090 and I'll work on a fix for that soon.

body: Sweet! I'll go ahead and work on this tomorrow. I don't think it should be too difficult!

issue.title: feat(multipart): Adds support for manually setting size

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
I also added a simple sanity test to make sure it doesn't override
a `Body` with an actual size. I also double checked that this works
with a project where we are using streams.

Closes #1090
